text: for New Yorkers in the morning every
second counts so in two trains pull up
to a station they try to guess which one
will leave first the first to arrive is
not necessarily the first to depart
that's the conundrum facing subway
riders at the Uptown 34th Street Station
cue N and our platform they wait at
subway doors listening for a clue
sometimes a conductor tells them which
train will go first sometimes not
sometimes a subway riders guess it right
sometimes not and while they're trained
idols another trick common to New
Yorkers is to run to the car they know
will be close to their exit gaining back
a few precious seconds maybe these two
conductors are discussing it you go
first
I insist but my riders they're patient
don't worry about it this guessing game
happens again and again
take a look at this woman running at an
impressive speed this footage was not
sped up now let's watch it again in slow
motion a timing is to be commended the
others who followed we're not so lucky
now they must wait another minute and 36
seconds before their train leaves this
is a lifetime for a New Yorker it means
there's no time to get coffee before the
morning meeting it means using the
excuse sorry my train was late
